column4: I cannot use "java" as a command in my terminal, even though I have JRE installed... Java applets in Firefox work fine, what's wrong?
prolly your path, check if the binarys are in your path
i found the binary, but the link is broken. where should it go to?
mine is linked to /etc/alternatives/java
same here :( what should I change and how?
which java package did you install?
i have icedtea and jre6
java worked before upgrading gutsy 7.10 to hardy
if you did an upgrade, might wanna try just purge and reinstall
might be faster than searching
which should I use, the official JRE or IcedTea?
sorry, I'm a coder so I always install the sun bins
I've never tried icedtea
ok thanks, I found the problem btw. How do I change a symbolic link?
thanks
np, you'll have to sudo that too
when using ln -s what's the first path to?
that you called the proper path?
the target of the link
you said you found your java binary rite?
and the second path is what? /usr/bin/java no matter what?
yes
the first path should be to the location of the java bin
thanks for your time bro, got it working :)
